alert.note: Alert for Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 1:29AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Walker and Dade Counties through 200 AM EST... At 129 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was near Fabius, or 9 miles south of Bridgeport, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Chattanooga Valley, Fairview, Stephensville, Rising Fawn, Chattanooga Valley, New England, Morganville, Cloudland Canyon State Park and Cooper Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EST for northwestern Georgia.
